staticPages.legalDescription: Access our legal documents and policies.
staticPages.termsOfServiceDescription: Terms governing use of our service
staticPages.cookiePolicyDescription: How we use cookies on our website
staticPages.privacyPolicyDescription: How we protect your personal data

privacyPolicy.statementSummaryContent: This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) explains how your information is collected, used and disclosed by Auditmos OU (“we” / “us” / “our”). This Policy applies where we are acting as a Data Controller with respect to the personal data of our website visitors, service users, clients, and partners.
privacyPolicy.whatForContent:
We will store and process your data in order to allow us to provide our products and services. This includes:

- Authenticating users and managing accounts.
- Enabling you to use the features of our products, such as sending and managing notifications.
- Monitoring the security and integrity of our platform by analyzing audit logs to detect suspicious behavior and investigate potential threats.
- To contact you about your use of the Services, including changes to policies.
- Processing financial information for billing and account management (via Stripe).
- For internal business purposes.
privacyPolicy.whatIfContact: What will happen if I contact you?
privacyPolicy.whatIfContactContent: If you contact us, we will use your data to send you the information that you have requested, updates, and other information that we think you will be interested in regarding our services.
privacyPolicy.whatStoredContent:
We will store your personal details in order to provide our services and run our company. This includes:

- **Account Information:** Name, email address, hashed passwords, and billing details.
- **Notification Data:** Content you transmit through our API or platform (payloads), which are processed to deliver notifications.
- **Technical Information:** Log Data (IP address, browser type), Usage Data (features used), and Device Information.
- **Cookies:** Strictly necessary cookies required for authentication and security.
privacyPolicy.whatSharedContent: We will not share your data with any third parties other than as described here to fulfill our obligations to you (e.g., Payment Processing via Stripe, Security via Cloudflare). We may share your information with regulators or legal bodies if required by law.
privacyPolicy.howLongContent: Auditmos OU retains data only as long as needed to provide our services and to meet operational, contractual, and regulatory requirements. Account data is retained for the life of the account. Transactional data is retained as required by tax law (usually 7 years). Notification logs are retained for a limited period for debugging and audit purposes before being deleted.
privacyPolicy.whoAccessContent: We will never sell, share or otherwise distribute your data to any other third party other than as described here. Access to your data is carefully controlled and restricted to authorized personnel.
privacyPolicy.howSecure: How is my data kept secure?
privacyPolicy.howSecureContent: We store your data on secure servers. We use industry-standard security protocols (HTTPS/TLS) to encrypt data in transit and at rest.
privacyPolicy.aboutPolicyContent: This policy sets out how we will collect, store, and process the information you provide to us. It aims to ensure protection of privacy rights, promote transparency, and comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
privacyPolicy.principlesContent: We adhere to the GDPR principles: Data must be processed fairly and lawfully; obtained for specific purposes; be adequate and relevant; be accurate; not held longer than necessary; processed in accordance with rights of data subjects; be protected appropriately; and not transferred internationally without adequate protection.
privacyPolicy.whoWeAre: Who We Are And How To Contact Us
privacyPolicy.whoWeAreContent:
Auditmos OU is a company registered in Estonia.

- **Name of Data Protection Lead:** Tomasz Kowalczyk
- **Company name:** Auditmos OU
- **Email:** legal@powiadomienia.info
privacyPolicy.article27Content: As Auditmos OU is established within the European Union (Estonia), we are not required to appoint an external Article 27 Representative for the EU.
privacyPolicy.euRepContent: Not applicable. We are an EU-based entity.
privacyPolicy.toWhom: To whom does this privacy policy apply?
privacyPolicy.toWhomContent: This policy applies to Employees, Customers, End-users of our Services, Website Visitors, and Partners.
privacyPolicy.whatApplies: What does this policy apply to?
privacyPolicy.whatAppliesContent: This section describes the purposes for processing your data, including information you provide when contacting us, account registration details, and technical usage data. It applies to all data processing activities required to deliver the powiadomienia.info service.
privacyPolicy.howCollected: How will your information be collected and used?
privacyPolicy.howCollectedContent:
We collect data primarily directly from you (registration) or automatically through your use of the service (logs). We use this data to:

- Register you as a customer (Performance of Contract).
- Process payments (Performance of Contract).
- Administer and protect our business (Legitimate Interest).
- Use data analytics to improve our website (Legitimate Interest).
privacyPolicy.changePrefsContent: We operate in line with GDPR. You can contact us at legal@powiadomienia.info to request access, rectification, deletion, or restriction of your data.
privacyPolicy.optingOut: Opting out at a later date
privacyPolicy.optingOutContent: You have the right to withdraw your consent at any time. You can object to the processing of your data and request its deletion, provided the data is not required for tax or legal obligations.
privacyPolicy.howStore: How we store and process your data
privacyPolicy.howStoreContent: Your data is stored securely on servers located within the European Union or with compliant service providers (like Cloudflare/Stripe). We retain data for as long as necessary to provide the service and meet legal obligations.
privacyPolicy.obligationsContent: As the Data Controller, we are responsible for handling your data. You have the right to request access, correction, erasure, objection, restriction, and transfer of your data.
privacyPolicy.thirdPartiesContent:
We may share your personal data with selected third parties:

| Third Party | Purpose |
|-------------|----------|
| Cloudflare | For security and content delivery |
| Stripe | For payment processing |
| Professional Advisers | Lawyers, auditors, insurers |
| Regulators | If required by law |
privacyPolicy.securityContent: We have implemented appropriate security measures to protect your personal data from accidental loss, unauthorized access, use, alteration, or disclosure. We will report any data breaches to relevant authorities within 72 hours.
privacyPolicy.cookiesContent: We use strictly necessary cookies to ensure the site functions correctly (e.g., keeping you logged in). For detailed information, please refer to our Cookie Policy.
privacyPolicy.contacting: Contacting us, exercising your information rights and Complaints
privacyPolicy.contactingContent: If you have questions, please contact Tomasz Kowalczyk at legal@powiadomienia.info. If you remain dissatisfied, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Estonian Data Protection Inspectorate (AKI) or your local data protection authority.

termsOfService.intro: UNLESS SUPERSEDED BY A MASTER SUBSCRIPTION AGREEMENT EXECUTED BY THE PARTIES, THESE TERMS GOVERN YOUR USE OF THE WEBSITE LOCATED AT POWIADOMIENIA.INFO (THE “SITE”) AND THE PLATFORM SERVICES MADE AVAILABLE BY AUDITMOS OU. THE SERVICES ARE NOT INTENDED FOR USE WITH CLASSIFIED INFORMATION OR DATA THAT WOULD REQUIRE ADDITIONAL SECURITY CLEARANCE BEYOND STANDARD GDPR COMPLIANCE.
termsOfService.agreementContent: By using the Services, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you don’t agree to be bound by these Terms, do not use the Services. If you are accessing and using the Services on behalf of a company (such as your employer) or other legal entity, you represent and warrant that you have the authority to bind that entity to the terms and conditions of these Terms.

definitions.item1: “Authorized Users” means employees, agents, consultants, contractors, or vendors authorized by Customer to use the Services.
definitions.item2: “Customer Materials” means all information, data, content (including notification payloads), and other materials submitted or transmitted by Customer through the Services.
definitions.item3: “Platform Services” means the proprietary notification and monitoring platform, APIs, and associated software made available by Auditmos OU.

termsOfService.privacyNoticeContent: Please review Auditmos OU’s Privacy Policy, available on our website, which also governs how we collect, use and share Customer’s and Authorized Users’ information.
termsOfService.changesTitle: CHANGES TO THESE TERMS OR THE SERVICES
termsOfService.changesContent: Auditmos OU may update these Terms from time to time. We will post the updated Terms on the Site. Customer’s continued use of the Services after updated Terms have been posted means that Customer accepts and agrees to the changes.

access.item1: Services: Subject to these Terms, Auditmos OU grants Customer a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable right to use the Services in accordance with the Documentation.
access.item3: Ownership: Auditmos OU reserves and solely owns all rights, title, and interest in and to the Platform, the underlying software, and all related Intellectual Property Rights.

termsOfService.subscriptionsContent: Auditmos OU requires payment of a fee for use of the Services as set forth on our pricing page. You agree to pay such fees via our payment processor (Stripe). Subscriptions automatically renew unless cancelled. All payments are non-refundable except as required by applicable law. If you exceed your plan's usage limits (e.g., number of notifications), overage fees may apply as described on the pricing page.
termsOfService.customerMaterialsContent: Customer grants Auditmos OU a license to use Customer Materials solely for the purpose of operating, improving, and providing the Services (e.g., sending your notifications). As between Customer and Auditmos OU, Customer owns all Customer Materials. Customer represents that they have the right to provide such data and that it does not violate any third-party rights.

support.title: Support
support.content: Auditmos OU will provide Customer with support for the Services via email or our help center documentation.

serviceLevels.title: Service Levels
serviceLevels.content: Auditmos OU will use commercially reasonable efforts to make the Services available 24/7, excluding planned downtime for maintenance and force majeure events. Service levels are performance targets and not guarantees.

termsOfService.confidentialContent: Each party agrees to protect the other party’s Confidential Information with the same degree of care it uses to protect its own. Confidential Information includes business technical information, pricing, and non-public product details. This obligation does not apply to information that is public, independently developed, or rightfully obtained from third parties.

mutual.title: Mutual Representations
mutual.content: Each Party represents that it has full power and authority to enter into these Terms.

customer.title: Customer Additional Representations
customer.content: Customer represents that its use of the Services will not violate any applicable laws (including anti-spam laws) or infringe on the rights of any third party.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.content: THE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED ON AN “AS IS” BASIS. AUDITMOS OU MAKES NO WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE RELIABILITY OR AVAILABILITY OF THE SERVICES.

similarity.title: Service Reliability
similarity.content: Due to the nature of internet communications, Auditmos OU cannot guarantee the delivery of every single notification if failure occurs due to third-party networks, ISPs, or the recipient's device settings. Auditmos OU is not liable for delays or delivery failures caused by external factors.

termsOfService.terminationContent: Auditmos OU may terminate or suspend access immediately if Customer breaches these Terms. Customer may terminate their subscription at any time via the Platform settings; such termination will take effect at the end of the current billing cycle. Upon termination, Customer’s right to use the Services ceases.
termsOfService.limitationContent: IN NO EVENT WILL AUDITMOS OU BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES. TOTAL LIABILITY SHALL NOT EXCEED THE FEES PAID BY CUSTOMER IN THE SIX (6) MONTHS PRECEDING THE CLAIM.
termsOfService.indemnificationContent: Customer will indemnify and hold Auditmos OU harmless from any claims arising out of Customer’s use of the Services, Customer Materials, or violation of these Terms.

general.item1: Governing Law: These Terms will be governed by the laws of Estonia. Any legal action will be brought exclusively in the courts located in Tallinn, Estonia.
general.item2: Assignment: Customer may not assign these Terms without prior written consent. Auditmos OU may assign these Terms freely.
general.item3: Notices: Notices to Auditmos OU should be sent to legal@powiadomienia.info.

exhibitA.title: EXHIBIT A – ACCEPTABLE USE POLICY
exhibitA.item1: You agree not to use the Services to transmit any content that is illegal, harmful, threatening, abusive, or defamatory.
exhibitA.item2: You agree not to use the Services to send unsolicited bulk messages (spam) or to harass individuals.
exhibitA.item3: You agree not to use the Services to attempt to deceive others, spread malware, or engage in phishing activities.

exhibitB.title: EXHIBIT B – SERVICE LEVELS AND SUPPORT
exhibitB.item1: Uptime Goal: We aim for 99.9% availability.
exhibitB.item2: Maintenance: We will provide notice for scheduled maintenance windows.
exhibitB.item3: Support: Support is available via email at legal@powiadomienia.info during business hours (EET).

cookiePolicy.purposeContent: This policy outlines our use of cookies and similar technologies. We use these technologies to make our website work and ensure the security of our services. This document explains what these technologies are, what they do, and how you can manage your preferences related to them.
cookiePolicy.scopeContent: This policy applies to all visitors and users of the powiadomienia.info website and its related services. The scope covers the use of cookies, which are small text files placed on your device when you visit a site. They allow us to recognize repeat visitors and record specific browsing information (e.g., how you arrive, pages you view, and paths you take).

howWeUse.title: How We Use Cookies
howWeUse.content: Our website uses cookies primarily from Auditmos OU and select third-party partners required for infrastructure and payments. These are categorized as Strictly Necessary cookies. Currently, we do not use Analytics or Marketing cookies.

detailedInfo.title: Detailed Cookie Information
detailedInfo.content: Here is a list of the primary technologies we use that may place cookies on your device.

strictlyNecessary.title: Strictly Necessary Cookies
strictlyNecessary.content:
These cookies are essential for our site and services to function correctly and cannot be disabled. They are necessary for security, payment processing, and core feature functionality. For example, ensuring you remain logged in while navigating the platform.

1. Source: Auditmos OU / powiadomienia.info
Purpose: To enable user authentication (via Email/Password or Google), manage active sessions, and log internal system errors for reliability.

2. Source: Stripe
Purpose: To provide fraud prevention and secure payment processing functionality.

3. Source: Cloudflare
Purpose: To maximize network resources, manage traffic, and protect the site from malicious traffic and bots.

analytics.title: Analytics & Tracking Cookies
analytics.content:
These “Not essential” cookies help us recognize repeat visitors and understand how you interact with our site so we can improve our site and services.

* Current Status: We do not currently use third-party analytics cookies.

marketing.title: Marketing Cookies
marketing.content:
These “Not essential” cookies from partners help us monitor website behavior to use for online advertising.

* Current Status: We do not currently use marketing or advertising cookies.

cookiePolicy.choicesTitle: Your Choices and How to Opt-Out

choices.item1: Browser Settings: You can block or delete cookies by changing your browser settings. Please refer to your browser’s “help” functionality for advice. Please note that should you block all cookies (including Strictly Necessary ones), you may not be able to log in or process payments on our site.
choices.item2: Service-Specific Opt-Outs: Because we currently only use cookies that are strictly necessary for the security and operation of the service (authentication, payments, firewall), there are no optional third-party services to opt-out of without breaking the site functionality.

cookiePolicy.choicesAdditional: For more general information on managing cookies, you can visit https://www.allaboutcookies.org/manage-cookies/index.html
cookiePolicy.exceptionsContent: Requests for an exception to this policy must be submitted to our security committee at (legal@powiadomienia.info) for approval.
cookiePolicy.violationsContent: Any known violations of this policy should be reported to our security committee at (legal@powiadomienia.info).
